intro: Gomesa barbaceniae, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings. Gomesa barbaceniae is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus.
